- [x] This is a **bugfix**
- [x] This is a **metadata update**

### For Bugs and Features; did you add new tests?

> Can publish a package with this PR and see if it actually works but these kind of fixes have been done multiple times to make Yarn 2 happy. Considering `webpack-dev-server` throws at runtime anyway if `webpack-cli` is missing this shouldn't bother anyone

### Motivation / Use-Case

Yarn 2 currently throws when using `webpack-dev-server` due to it trying to require `webpack-cli` without declaring it anywhere in its dependencies:

```
Error: A package is trying to access another package without the second one being listed as a dependency of the first one

Required package: webpack-cli (via "webpack-cli/bin/config-yargs")
Required by: webpack-dev-server@virtual:836be30d0802b4899b9a78ca9d744f43f038cccf96d6b8307cbd938d17151f1ac108d2e64290515733c51d0949e0c6d87f9a7c9e245dfe628e5c4ef98f22d752#npm:3.8.0 
```

### Breaking Changes

There is no breaking change for anyone - not even a warning for older package managers. This is a completely safe bugfix that will only impact Yarn users.

### Additional Info

Supercedes: https://github.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/pull/2191

Documentation: https://next.yarnpkg.com/configuration/manifest#peerDependenciesMeta.optional
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [@commitlint/cli](https://togithub.com/conventional-changelog/commitlint) | devDependencies | patch | [`^8.3.4` -> `^8.3.5`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/@commitlint%2fcli/8.3.4/8.3.5) |
| [memfs](https://togithub.com/streamich/memfs) | devDependencies | patch | [`^3.0.3` -> `^3.0.4`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/memfs/3.0.3/3.0.4) |
| [style-loader](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/style-loader) | devDependencies | patch | [`^1.1.2` -> `^1.1.3`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/style-loader/1.1.2/1.1.3) |
| [typescript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/Microsoft/TypeScript)) | devDependencies | patch | [`^3.7.4` -> `^3.7.5`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/typescript/3.7.4/3.7.5) |

    -   [#&#8203;10507](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10507) Prepare [@&#8203;babel/core](https://togithub.com/babel/core) for asynchronicity ([@&#8203;nicolo-ribaudo](https://togithub.com/nicolo-ribaudo))
-   Other
    -   [#&#8203;10979](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10979) Reduce false negative cases of typescript parser tests ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10976](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10976) Update Test262, Flow and TS parser tests ([@&#8203;nicolo-ribaudo](https://togithub.com/nicolo-ribaudo))
    -   [#&#8203;10964](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10964) Bump coverage target from 80% to 90% ([@&#8203;nicolo-ribaudo](https://togithub.com/nicolo-ribaudo))
    -   [#&#8203;10958](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10958) Fix recent e2e-vuejs-cli error ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10919](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10919) Add integration test: e2e-vue-cli  ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10943](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10943) chore: update test262 ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10918](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10918) chore: refine e2e test scripts ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10905](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10905) chore: separate build-standalone with coverage ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10898](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10898) Move coverage to GitHub actions ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
-   `babel-compat-data`, `babel-helper-compilation-targets`, `babel-preset-env`
    -   [#&#8203;10899](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10899) Extract targets parser and compat data from preset-env ([@&#8203;nicolo-ribaudo](https://togithub.com/nicolo-ribaudo))
-   `babel-parser`
    -   [#&#8203;10950](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10950) test: add invalid-lone-import test ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10936](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10936) refactor: remove unecessary checkYieldAwaitInDefaultParams ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10935](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10935) refactor: remove unused invalidTemplateEscapePosition tokenizer state ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10939](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10939) TSTypeCastExpression should not be inside call parameters ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
    -   [#&#8203;10942](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10942) Remove unused parser methods ([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))

    -   [#&#8203;10849](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10849) chore: specify package type [skip-ci]([@&#8203;JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))

-   `babel-cli`

<details>
<summary>benmosher/eslint-plugin-import</summary>

### [`v2.20.0`](https://togithub.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#&#8203;2200---2020-01-10)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/compare/v2.19.1...v2.20.0)

##### Added

-   [`order`]&#x3A; added `caseInsensitive` as an additional option to `alphabetize` ([#&#8203;1586], thanks [@&#8203;dbrewer5])
-   [`no-restricted-paths`]&#x3A; New `except` option per `zone`, allowing exceptions to be defined for a restricted zone ([#&#8203;1238], thanks [@&#8203;rsolomon])
-   [`order`]&#x3A; add option pathGroupsExcludedImportTypes to allow ordering of external import types ([#&#8203;1565], thanks [@&#8203;Mairu])

##### Fixed

-   [`no-unused-modules`]&#x3A; fix usage of `import/extensions` settings ([#&#8203;1560], thanks [@&#8203;stekycz])
-   [`extensions`]&#x3A; ignore non-main modules ([#&#8203;1563], thanks [@&#8203;saschanaz])
-   TypeScript config: lookup for external modules in [@&#8203;types](https://togithub.com/types) folder ([#&#8203;1526], thanks [@&#8203;joaovieira])
-   [`no-extraneous-dependencies`]&#x3A; ensure `node.source` is truthy ([#&#8203;1589], thanks [@&#8203;ljharb])
-   [`extensions`]&#x3A; Ignore query strings when checking for extensions ([#&#8203;1572], thanks [@&#8203;pcorpet])

##### Docs

-   [`extensions`]&#x3A; improve `ignorePackages` docs ([#&#8203;1248], thanks [@&#8203;ivo-stefchev])

</details>

- [ ] This is a **bugfix**
- [x] This is a **feature**
- [ ] This is a **code refactor**
- [ ] This is a **test update**
- [ ] This is a **docs update**
- [ ] This is a **metadata update**

### For Bugs and Features; did you add new tests?

<!-- Please note that we won't approve your changes if you don't add tests. -->

### Motivation / Use-Case

<!--
  What existing problem does the pull request solve?

  Please explain the motivation or use-case for making this change.
  If this Pull Request addresses an issue, please link to the issue.
-->

This is to help reading the output of the webpack-dev-middleware when using a single compiler and multiple servers. Currently, the logs are not very useful, since they just prefix everything with `[wdm]` because the logger isn't forwarded via options, and we can't pass it via `options` since it's not part of the schema.

I attached a screenshot that explains why it's a bit hard to read the logs.

### Breaking Changes

<!--
  If this PR introduces a breaking change, please describe the impact and a
  potential migration path for existing applications.
-->

I don't believe this can break anything

### Additional Info

Current logs:
![Screen Shot 2020-01-08 at 17 41 26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3650621/71997502-41b58e00-323e-11ea-8d4c-944b2ff69c11.png)


- [x] This is a **code refactor**

### Motivation / Use-Case
This upgrades `http-proxy-middleware` to v0.20.0 and updates `micromatch` (a transitive dependency) to v4.x.x

### Breaking Changes
`micromatch` 4 drops support for node < 8, but the `next` branch has already dropped support for node < 8.
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [husky](https://togithub.com/typicode/husky) | devDependencies | major | [`^3.1.0` -> `^4.0.10`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/husky/3.1.0/4.0.10) |

---

### [`v4.0.0`](https://togithub.com/typicode/husky/releases/v4.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/typicode/husky/compare/v3.1.0...v4.0.0)

-   Support `Yarn v2` new Plug'n'Play feature (thanks to [@&#8203;arcanis](https://togithub.com/arcanis))
-   Improve path handling on Windows (in particular with `Cygwin` and `Cmdr`)
-   Remove `dependencies` and simplify code
-   **Breaking** requires `Node 10+`

**Thanks to all contributors and everyone who is supporting Husky on [Open Collective](https://opencollective.com/husky), [GitHub sponsors](https://togithub.com/sponsors/typicode) and [Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/typicode)!**

- Operating System: macOS 10.15.2
- Node Version: 12.8.1
- NPM Version: 6.10.2
- webpack Version: see `package.json` below
- webpack-dev-server Version: see `package.json` below
- Browser: N/A

  Please note that we are NOT accepting FEATURE requests at this time.
-->

- [x] This is a **bug**
- [ ] This is a **modification** request

### Code

<!--
  If you have a large amount of code to share which demonstrates the problem
  you're experiencing, or your webpack config is very large, please provide a link
  to your repository rather than pasting code. We'd also encourage you to use a
  Github Gist link instead of pasting code. Otherwise, please paste relevant
  short snippets below.

  For bugs, please do consider providing a link to a stripped-down, bare-bones
  repo that can reproduce the problem you're experiencing. Many times, bugs
  aren't actual bugs, but rather specific issues with loaders, plugins, or
  an environment/OS. Problems with complicated or large applications will almost
  always require this to be triaged.
-->

```js
// webpack.config.js
module.exports = {
    devServer: {
        port: 4000,
        proxy: {
            '/api': 'http://localhost:3000'
        }
    }
}
```

```js
// index.js
const express = require("express");

const app = express();

app.get("*", (req, res) => {
  res.send("foo");
});

// error handling middleware
app.use((error, req, res, next) => {
  res.send("my custom error page");
});

app.listen(3000);
```

```jsonc
// package.json
{
  "dependencies": {
    "express": "^4.17.1",
    "webpack": "^4.41.5",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.10",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^3.10.1"
  }
}
```

### Expected Behavior

1. Run `node index.js`
2. Run `webpack-dev-server`
3. `curl "localhost:4000/api/%"`

The response should be `"my custom error page"`, indicating that the Express error handling middleware for the API server was used.

### Actual Behavior

The response is `URIError: Failed to decode param ‚Ä¶`, indicating that the Express error handling middleware for the API server was _not_ used.

I would not expect `webpack-dev-server` to change how errors are handled for proxied requests.

#### Technical notes

I played around with using `http-proxy-middleware` on its own to see if the root issue was inside there, but using the following code, I could not reproduce this issue:

```ts
const httpProxyMiddleware = require("http-proxy-middleware");
const express = require("express");

{
  const app = express();

  app.get("*", (req, res) => {
    res.send("foo");
  });

  app.use((error, req, res, next) => {
    res.send("my custom error page");
  });

  app.listen(3000);
}

{
  const app = express();

  app.use(httpProxyMiddleware({ target: "http://localhost:3000" }));

  app.listen(4000);
}
```

### For Bugs; How can we reproduce the behavior?

See above

### For Features; What is the motivation and/or use-case for the feature?

N/A
When opening in browser my UMD library I'm getting the following error in the browser's console:
> (index):111 Uncaught ReferenceError: %LIBRARY_NAME% is not defined

Whereas when I open it without webpack-dev-server (I mean just starting `http-server` at *docs* directory) everything works as expected.

Looking through the sources, I found that devServer's build version of my library, unlike the regular one, returns checkDeferredModules() which apparently doesn't return the main module's exports.

The output of my library is configured like this:
```javascript
output: {
  library: {
    amd: 'hall-plan',
    commonjs: 'hall-plan',
    root: 'HallPlan',
  },
  libraryTarget: 'umd',
  libraryExport: 'default',
  filename: `[name]${DEBUG ? '' : '.min'}.js`,
  path: path.join(__dirname, 'dist'),
},
```
and devServer:
```js
devServer: {
  contentBase: [
    path.join(__dirname, 'docs'),
    path.join(__dirname, 'dist'),
  ],
},
```
Also an interesting thing happens when I specify the port of devServer to any other than 8080. I got an additional error just before the one described above:
>  Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'default' of undefined

Which happens here:
```js
/***/ 0:
/*!*****************************************************************************!*\
  !*** multi (webpack)-dev-server/client?http://localhost:8081 ./src/main.ts ***!
  \*****************************************************************************/
/*! no static exports found */
/***/ (function(module, exports, __webpack_require__) {

__webpack_require__(/*! C:\Users\lexkr\Workspace\hall-plan\node_modules\webpack-dev-server\client\index.js?http://localhost:8081 */"./node_modules/webpack-dev-server/client/index.js?http://localhost:8081");
module.exports = __webpack_require__(/*! ./src/main.ts */"./src/main.ts");


/***/ })

/******/ })["default"];      // <----------- HERE
```
- Operating System: Linux
- Node Version: 12
- NPM Version: 6
- webpack Version: 4
- webpack-dev-server Version: 3
- Browser: Chrome



- [x ] This is a **bug**
- [ ] This is a **modification** request

### Code

<!--
  If you have a large amount of code to share which demonstrates the problem
  you're experiencing, or your webpack config is very large, please provide a link
  to your repository rather than pasting code. We'd also encourage you to use a
  Github Gist link instead of pasting code. Otherwise, please paste relevant
  short snippets below.

  For bugs, please do consider providing a link to a stripped-down, bare-bones
  repo that can reproduce the problem you're experiencing. Many times, bugs
  aren't actual bugs, but rather specific issues with loaders, plugins, or
  an environment/OS. Problems with complicated or large applications will almost
  always require this to be triaged.
-->

```js
  output: {
    path: path.resolve(ROOT_PATH, 'dist'),
    publicPath: '0.0.0.0:10005/',
    filename: '[name].bundle.js',
    chunkFilename: '[id].bundle.js'
  },
  devServer: {
    allowedHosts: ['.ec2.pin220.com', '.pinterdev.com'],
    // 0.0.0.0 binds to all interfaces. The public port is 8080 which is served
    // by nginx and proxied to the internal webpack port of 10005.
    host: '0.0.0.0',
    port: 10005,
    hotOnly: true,
    publicPath: '0.0.0.0:10005/'
  }
```

```js
if (module.hot) module.hot.accept();

const root = document.getElementById('root');

if (root !== null) {
  ReactDOM.render(<App />, root);
}

```

### Expected Behavior
Work
### Actual Behavior
Doesn't work, just says 
```
[WDS] App hot update...
log.js?1afd:24 [HMR] Checking for updates on the server...
```

<!--
  Thank you for submitting a pull request!

  Please note that this template is not optional and all _ALL_ fields must be filled out, or your pull request may be rejected.

  Please do not delete this template.
  Please do remove this header to acknowledge this message.

  Please place an x, no spaces, in all [ ] that apply
-->

- [ ] This is a **bugfix**
- [x] This is a **feature**
- [ ] This is a **code refactor**
- [ ] This is a **test update**
- [ ] This is a **docs update**
- [ ] This is a **metadata update**

### For Bugs and Features; did you add new tests?

yes

### Motivation / Use-Case

This allows configuration of the proxy to be dynamic based off the Express `req`, `res`, and `next` args.

https://github.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/2360#issue-539948540

### Breaking Changes

None
